H0.text: Velocity is the term for a measure of both speed and direction.

H1.text: Acceleration is a measure of both speed and direction.

H2.text: Momentum is the term for a measure of both speed and direction.

H3.text: Intensity is the term for a measure of both speed and direction.

A4.text: Velocity is a vector quantity, meaning that both magnitude and direction are needed.

A5.text: Acceleration occurs when there is a change in speed, direction, or both.
